--- In junit@egroups.com, kellydai99@y... wrote:
> where can i find information about junit extension on netBeans or 
> forte?

You can find a how-to 
at http://innertesters.netbeans.org/junit-style.html. The guy who 
wrote it is actually me ;-). I use this integration for (almost) every 
class I write. All the test-methods will be inside a public static 
inner class called TEST, which will not pollute your productive code 
due to the cross-directory-compiler. On the other hand it is always 
with the class you want to test, yet not messing up its namespace.
If you do something more sophisticated with it, please let me (and 
this mailing-list of course) know.

hth
Norder
subject: Re: junit extension on netBeans or forte
